meanings.definition: A border or edging around something.
meanings.sent1: The bordure of the painting was adorned with intricate patterns.
meanings.sent2: She sewed a colorful bordure around the quilt.
meanings.sent3: The playful kitten kept chasing its tail in circles along the bordure of the rug.
meanings.sent4: The laughter of children formed a joyful bordure around the park.
meanings.sent5: The golden bordure of the sunset painted the sky in hues of orange and pink.

meanings.definition: To provide with a border or edging.
meanings.sent1: He carefully bordured the garden beds with small stones.
meanings.sent2: The tailor bordured the dress with delicate lace.
meanings.sent3: The chef bordured the cake with fresh strawberries, creating a beautiful design.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness bordured her actions, making everyone feel welcome.
meanings.sent5: The artist bordured the canvas with bold strokes of paint, framing the masterpiece.

meanings.definition: The outer edge of a heraldic shield.
meanings.sent1: The family crest displayed a lion on the bordure of the shield.
meanings.sent2: The knight proudly bore the bordure of his lineage on his shield.
meanings.sent3: The dragon emblem on the bordure of the shield seemed to come alive in the firelight.
meanings.sent4: The intricate design on the bordure of the shield told the story of a noble lineage.
meanings.sent5: The silver bordure of the shield gleamed in the sunlight, a symbol of honor and strength.
